meanings.definition: A rhythmic beat or pulse in music.
meanings.sent1: The song had a catchy oonts that made everyone dance.
meanings.sent2: The drummer added an extra oonts to the chorus.
meanings.sent3: The oonts of the music was so infectious that even the shyest person couldn't resist tapping their foot.
meanings.sent4: The oonts of the bass guitar reverberated through the entire concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The oonts of the drums set the perfect rhythm for the band to follow.

meanings.definition: To add energy or excitement to something.
meanings.sent1: She knew she needed to oonts up the party with some lively music.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk really oontsed the team before the big game.
meanings.sent3: His jokes never failed to oonts up the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: The surprise fireworks display oontsed the crowd at the festival.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations oontsed the plain room into a festive space.

meanings.definition: A strong, driving force or momentum.
meanings.sent1: The project had a powerful oonts that kept everyone motivated.
meanings.sent2: The leader's vision provided the necessary oonts for the team to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The oonts behind the charity event was the desire to help those in need.
meanings.sent4: The oonts of the engine propelled the car forward with great speed.
meanings.sent5: The oonts of the crowd's cheers spurred the athlete to give their best performance.
